H0.text: The Sun is very pretty is a statement of fact.

H1.text: The Sun is fun to study is a statement of fact that answers the question “Which is a statement of fact?”

H2.text: The Sun is larger than Earth.

H3.text: The Sun is more interesting than the Moon is a statement of fact according to the question “Which is a statement of fact?”

A4.text: These measurements determined the Sun to be the natural object closest to a perfect sphere ever observed.

A5.text: The Sun has been an object of veneration in many cultures and a central subject for astronomical research since antiquity.

A6.text: 695,700 kilometres (432,300 miles) is approximately 10 times the average radius of Jupiter; 109 times the 6378 km radius of the Earth at its equator.

A7.text: Observations of sunspots were recorded by Chinese astronomers during the Han dynasty (202 BC – AD 220).

A8.text: The Sun is the main source of energy for life on Earth.
